assembly.name: incorrect_return
assembly.description: Detect if `return` in an assembly block halts unexpectedly the execution.

assembly.name: return_instead_of_leave
assembly.description: Detect if a `return` is used where a `leave` should be used.

assembly.name: shift_parameter_mixup
assembly.description: Detect if the values in a shift operation are reversed

attributes.name: constant_pragma
attributes.description: Detect whether different Solidity versions are used.

attributes.name: const_functions_asm
attributes.description: Constant functions using assembly code"  # help information

attributes.name: const_functions_state
attributes.description: Constant functions changing the state"  # help information

attributes.name: locked_ether
attributes.description: Contract with a `payable` function, but without a withdrawal capacity.

compiler_bugs.name: public_mapping_nested
compiler_bugs.description: Prior to Solidity 0.5, a public mapping with nested structures returned [incorrect values](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/5520).

compiler_bugs.name: reused_base_constructor
compiler_bugs.description: Detects if the same base constructor is called with arguments from two different locations in the same inheritance hierarchy.

compiler_bugs.name: storage_ABIEncoderV2_array
compiler_bugs.description: `solc` versions `0.4.7`-`0.5.9` contain a [compiler bug](https://blog.ethereum.org/2019/06/25/solidity-storage-array-bugs) leading to incorrect ABI encoder usage.

compiler_bugs.name: uninitialized_function_ptr_in_constructor
compiler_bugs.description: solc versions `0.4.5`-`0.4.26` and `0.5.0`-`0.5.8` contain a compiler bug leading to unexpected behavior when calling uninitialized function pointers in constructors.

erc.name: incorrect_erc721_interface
erc.description: Incorrect return values for `ERC721` functions. A contract compiled with solidity > 0.4.22 interacting with these functions will fail to execute them, as the return value is missing.

erc.name: unindexed_event_parameters
erc.description: Detects whether events defined by the `ERC20` specification that should have some parameters as `indexed` are missing the `indexed` keyword.

erc.name: arbitrary_send_erc20
erc.description: Detects instances where ERC20 can be sent from an arbitrary from address.      def __init__(self, compilation_unit: SlitherCompilationUnit) -> None:         self._compilation_unit = compilation_unit

erc.name: arbitrary_send_erc20_no_permit
erc.description: Detect when `msg.sender` is not used as `from` in transferFrom.

erc.name: arbitrary_send_erc20_permit
erc.description: transferFrom uses arbitrary from with permit

erc.name: incorrect_erc20_interface
erc.description: Incorrect return values for `ERC20` functions. A contract compiled with Solidity > 0.4.22 interacting with these functions will fail to execute them, as the return value is missing.

functions.name: arbitrary_send_eth
functions.description: Unprotected call to a function sending Ether to an arbitrary address.

functions.name: chainlink_feed_registry
functions.description: Detect when Chainlink Feed Registry is used. At the moment is only available on Ethereum Mainnet.

functions.name: cyclomatic_complexity
functions.description: Detects functions with high (> 11) cyclomatic complexity.

functions.name: external_function
functions.description: `public` functions that are never called by the contract should be declared `external`, and its immutable parameters should be located in `calldata` to save gas.

functions.name: gelato_unprotected_randomness
functions.description: Detect calls to `_requestRandomness` within an unprotected function.

functions.name: modifier
functions.description: If a modifier does not execute `_` or revert, the execution of the function will return the default value, which can be misleading for the caller.

functions.name: optimism_deprecation
functions.description: Detect when deprecated Optimism predeploy or function is used.

functions.name: permit_domain_signature_collision
functions.description: An ERC20 token has a function whose signature collides with EIP-2612's DOMAIN_SEPARATOR(), causing unanticipated behavior for contracts using `permit` functionality.

functions.name: protected_variable
functions.description: Detect unprotected variable that are marked protected

functions.name: pyth_deprecated_functions
functions.description: Detect when a Pyth deprecated function is used

functions.name: suicidal
functions.description: Unprotected call to a function executing `selfdestruct`/`suicide`.

functions.name: unimplemented
functions.description: Detect functions that are not implemented on derived-most contracts.

operations.name: bad_prng
operations.description: Weak PRNG due to a modulo on `block.timestamp`, `now` or `blockhash`. These can be influenced by miners to some extent so they should be avoided.

operations.name: cache_array_length
operations.description: Detects `for` loops that use `length` member of some storage array in their loop condition and don't modify it.

operations.name: encode_packed
operations.description: Detect collision due to dynamic type usages in `abi.encodePacked`

operations.name: incorrect_exp
operations.description: Detect use of bitwise `xor ^` instead of exponential `**`

operations.name: low_level_calls
operations.description: The use of low-level calls is error-prone. Low-level calls do not check for [code existence](https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/v0.4.25/control-structures.html#error-handling-assert-require-revert-and-exceptions) or call success.

operations.name: missing_events_access_control
operations.description: Detect missing events for critical access control parameters

operations.name: missing_events_arithmetic
operations.description: Detect missing events for critical arithmetic parameters.

operations.name: unchecked_low_level_return_values
operations.description: The return value of a low-level call is not checked.

operations.name: unchecked_send_return_value
operations.description: The return value of a `send` is not checked.

operations.name: unchecked_transfer
operations.description: The return value of an external transfer/transferFrom call is not checked

operations.name: void_constructor
operations.description: Detect the call to a constructor that is not implemented

reentrancy.name: reentrancy
reentrancy.description: "     Re-entrancy detection      Based on heuristics, it may lead to FP and FN     Iterate over all the nodes of the graph until reaching a fixpoint

reentrancy.name: reentrancy_events
reentrancy.description: Reentrancy vulnerabilities leading to out-of-order Events

reentrancy.name: reentrancy_no_gas
reentrancy.description: Reentrancy vulnerabilities through send and transfer

shadowing.name: abstract
shadowing.description: Detection of state variables shadowed from abstract contracts.

shadowing.name: builtin_symbols
shadowing.description: Detection of shadowing built-in symbols using local variables, state variables, functions, modifiers, or events.

shadowing.name: common
shadowing.description: Helper function that returns true if 'variable' is a gap variable used     for upgradable contracts. More specifically, the function returns true if:      - variable is named "__gap"      - it is a ui

shadowing.name: local
shadowing.description: Detection of shadowing using local variables.

slither.name: name_reused
slither.description: If a codebase has two contracts the similar names, the compilation artifacts

source.name: rtlo
source.description: An attacker can manipulate the logic of the contract by using a right-to-left-override character (`U+202E)`.

statements.name: array_length_assignment
statements.description: Detects the direct assignment of an array's length.

statements.name: assembly
statements.description: The use of assembly is error-prone and should be avoided.

statements.name: assert_state_change
statements.description: Incorrect use of `assert()`. See Solidity best [practices](https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/control-structures.html#id4).

statements.name: boolean_constant_equality
statements.description: Detects the comparison to boolean constants.

statements.name: boolean_constant_misuse
statements.description: Detects the misuse of a Boolean constant.

statements.name: calls_in_loop
statements.description: Calls inside a loop might lead to a denial-of-service attack.

statements.name: chronicle_unchecked_price
statements.description: Chronicle oracle is used and the price returned is not checked to be valid. For more information https://docs.chroniclelabs.org/Resources/FAQ/Oracles#how-do-i-check-if-an-oracle-becomes-inactive-gets-deprecated.

statements.name: controlled_delegatecall
statements.description: `Delegatecall` or `callcode` to an address controlled by the user.

statements.name: costly_operations_in_loop
statements.description: Costly operations in a loop

statements.name: delegatecall_in_loop
statements.description: Detect the use of `delegatecall` inside a loop in a payable function.

statements.name: deprecated_calls
statements.description: Detect the usage of deprecated standards.

statements.name: divide_before_multiply
statements.description: Solidity's integer division truncates. Thus, performing division before multiplication can lead to precision loss.

statements.name: incorrect_strict_equality
statements.description: Use of strict equalities that can be easily manipulated by an attacker.

statements.name: incorrect_using_for
statements.description: Detects using-for statement usage when no function from a given library matches a given type

statements.name: mapping_deletion
statements.description: A deletion in a structure containing a mapping will not delete the mapping (see the [Solidity documentation](https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types.html##delete)). The remaining data may be used to compromise the contract.

statements.name: msg_value_in_loop
statements.description: Detect the use of `msg.value` inside a loop.

statements.name: pyth_unchecked
statements.description: Documentation: This detector finds deprecated Pyth function calls

statements.name: pyth_unchecked_confidence
statements.description: Detect when the confidence level of a Pyth price is not checked

statements.name: pyth_unchecked_publishtime
statements.description: Detect when the publishTime of a Pyth price is not checked

statements.name: redundant_statements
statements.description: Detect the usage of redundant statements that have no effect.

statements.name: return_bomb
statements.description: A low level callee may consume all callers gas unexpectedly.

statements.name: tautological_compare
statements.description: A variable compared to itself is probably an error as it will always return `true` for `

statements.name: too_many_digits
statements.description: Conformance to numeric notation best practices

statements.name: tx_origin
statements.description: `tx.origin`-based protection can be abused by a malicious contract if a legitimate user interacts with the malicious contract.

statements.name: type_based_tautology
statements.description: Detects expressions that are tautologies or contradictions.

statements.name: unary
statements.description: Unary expressions such as `x

statements.name: unprotected_upgradeable
statements.description: Detects logic contract that can be destructed.

statements.name: unused_import
statements.description: Importing a file that is not used in the contract likely indicates a mistake. The import should be removed until it is needed.

statements.name: write_after_write
statements.description: Detects variables that are written but never read and written again.

variables.name: could_be_constant
variables.description: State variables that are not updated following deployment should be declared constant to save gas.

variables.name: could_be_immutable
variables.description: State variables that are not updated following deployment should be declared immutable to save gas.

variables.name: function_init_state_variables
variables.description: Detects the immediate initialization of state variables through function calls that are not pure/constant, or that use non-constant state variable.

variables.name: predeclaration_usage_local
variables.description: Detects the possible usage of a variable before the declaration is stepped over (either because it is later declared, or declared in another scope).

variables.name: unchanged_state_variables
variables.description: Module detecting state variables that could be declared as constant

variables.name: uninitialized_storage_variables
variables.description: An uninitialized storage variable will act as a reference to the first state variable, and can override a critical variable.

variables.name: var_read_using_this
variables.description: The contract reads its own variable using `this`, adding overhead of an unnecessary STATICCALL.
